definition: Person with knowledge of how to access, troubleshoot, or address issues related to the resource.
scope_note: May also be used as the point of contact in an organization controlling access, if different from Publisher/Distributor/Data Manager.

definition: Person or institution responsible for gathering/collecting data under the guidance of the author(s) or Principal Investigator.
scope_note: May also cover survey conductors, interviewers, observers, or those monitoring instrument data.

definition: Person tasked with reviewing, enhancing, cleaning, or standardizing metadata and associated data submitted for storage, use, and maintenance within a repository.
scope_note: Role emphasizes content/metadata quality assurance; distinct from DataManager which emphasizes digital maintenance.

definition: Person or organization responsible for maintaining the finished resource (e.g., refreshing, availability, protection, storage standards).
scope_note: Focus is ongoing digital maintenance and stewardship of the resource over time.

definition: Institution responsible for generating and disseminating copies of the resource in electronic or print form.
scope_note: Works stored in more than one archive/repository may credit each as a distributor.

definition: Person who oversees details related to the publication format of the resource.
scope_note: If credited in place of multiple creators, the editor may be listed as Creator with “(Ed.)” appended.

definition: Organization that makes the resource available (online or offline) by providing hardware/software/operational support.
scope_note: Often the university, research center, or organization associated with the data center/repository.

definition: Person or organization responsible for the artistry and form of a media product.
scope_note: In data contexts, may be an entity producing media packaging for dissemination by a distributor.

definition: Person officially designated as head of a project team or sub-project team instrumental in developing the resource.
scope_note: Typically remains closely involved throughout the project’s lifecycle and deliverables.

definition: Person officially designated as manager of a project (which may include multiple teams/sub-teams).
scope_note: Typically has more administrative responsibility than direct work involvement.

definition: Person listed as a member of a designated project or project team.
scope_note: Does not necessarily indicate the quality, quantity, or substance of involvement.

definition: Organization appointed by a Registration Authority to handle specific tasks within a defined responsibility area.
scope_note: Example in DOI context: DataCite acting as a Registration Agency for the International DOI Foundation.

definition: Standards-setting body from which Registration Agencies obtain official recognition and guidance.
scope_note: In DOI context: the International DOI Foundation serves as the Registration Authority for ISO in the DOI domain.

definition: Person without a specifically defined role in developing the resource, but recognized by the author(s).
scope_note: May be an intellectual mentor or disciplinary leader the author wishes to acknowledge.

definition: Person involved in analyzing data or results of an experiment or formal study (may include interns/assistants).
scope_note: Should be a person (not an institution). Data gathering is better captured by DataCollector.

definition: Group of individuals (lab/department/division) with a defined focus of activity.
scope_note: May operate at narrower scope; may have different administrative responsibility than a project team.

definition: Person or institution owning or managing property rights, including intellectual property rights, over the resource.
Person or organization that issued a contract or under whose auspices a work was written, published, or developed.
scope_note: Includes in-kind support (donations, people, facilities, instrumentation) necessary for development.

definition: Designated administrator overseeing one or more groups/teams producing a resource, or one or more steps in a development process.
Person responsible for ensuring comprehensive contents, versioning, and availability of a work package during resource development.
scope_note: A work package may include recognized data products plus supporting/discarded materials not all included in publication.

definition: Any significant contributor whose role is not adequately described by the other contributorType values.
scope_note: Can include roles such as photographer/artist/writer for promotion, reviewers, administrative support, etc.
